headline: Here Are Wednesday’s Top Wall Street Analyst Research Calls: AbbVie, Angel Studios, First Solar, IBM, Kroger, Molson Coors, Oracle, Workday, and More
summary: Pre-Market Stock Futures: Futures are trading higher this morning, but what a difference a day makes after a “Meltdown Monday.” Stocks rallied on Tuesday, and all major indices closed higher. While not recouping all of the losses from Monday, a strong bounce-back was a welcome sight for investors. A combination of a rebound in technology ... headline: Wells Fargo Downgrades Kroger to Equal-Weight, Lowers Price Target to $68
summary: Wells Fargo  analyst Edward Kelly   downgrades Kroger (NYSE:KR) from Overweight to Equal-Weight and lowers the price target from $70 to $68.

raw.headline: Wells Fargo Downgrades Kroger to Equal-Weight, Lowers Price Target to $68
raw.summary: Wells Fargo  analyst Edward Kelly   downgrades Kroger (NYSE:KR) from Overweight to Equal-Weight and lowers the price target from $70 to $68.

headline: Kroger’s New CEO Brings Walmart Experience To Cost Focus And Margins
summary: Kroger appointed former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new CEO as part of a cost-cutting and restructuring plan. The leadership change follows the prior CEO’s exit over an ethics violation. The company is pursuing operational streamlining and a refocus of the business at a time of industry pressure. Kroger, listed as NYSE:KR, enters this leadership transition with shares at $69.76. The stock shows longer term resilience, with a 72.8% return over 3 years and 138.3% over 5 years, while...
